# Copilot Instructions for Email Database Manager

## Project Overview

This repository contains an email database manager application. The project helps manage and organize email databases efficiently.

## Development Guidelines

### General Principles

- Write clean, readable, and maintainable code
- Follow consistent naming conventions
- Add comments for complex logic
- Keep functions small and focused on a single responsibility

### Code Style

- Use meaningful variable and function names that describe their purpose
- Follow standard language-specific conventions
- Organize imports and dependencies logically
- Remove unused code and dependencies

### Testing

- Write tests for new features and bug fixes
- Ensure tests are clear and well-documented
- Test edge cases and error conditions
- Run tests before committing changes

### Documentation

- Update README.md when adding new features or changing setup procedures
- Document public APIs and interfaces
- Keep inline comments up-to-date with code changes
- Include usage examples where appropriate

### Git Practices

- Write clear, descriptive commit messages
- Keep commits focused on a single change
- Reference issue numbers in commit messages when applicable
- Ensure the working tree is clean before creating pull requests

## Best Practices

- Handle errors gracefully with appropriate error messages
- Validate user input and data
- Follow security best practices (sanitize inputs, protect sensitive data)
- Optimize for performance where it matters
- Consider scalability in design decisions

## Getting Started

When contributing to this project:

1. Review existing code to understand the project structure
2. Follow the established patterns and conventions
3. Test your changes thoroughly
4. Update documentation as needed
5. Ensure all tests pass before submitting
